item.title: Coronavirus: US authorises use of anti-viral drug Remdesivir
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration authorises emergency use of the experimental anti-viral drug.

item.title: Kim Jong-un appears in public, North Korean state media report
item.description: North Korea's Kim Jong-un makes his first public appearance for 20 days, state media report, amid speculation about his health.

item.title: Coronavirus: Eight ways the lockdown has changed the UK
item.description: After three weeks of the restrictions, many aspects of everyday life have been transformed.

item.title: Coronavirus: Commuter 'fever check' and Princess Charlotte turns five
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak this morning.

item.title: Coronavirus: Thousands signal interest in plasma trial
item.description: It is hoped the antibodies recovered patients have built up will help clear the virus in others.

item.title: Coronavirus: Commuters could be asked to check their temperature
item.description: Proposals to make public transport safer being considered as part of plans for easing coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Elon Musk tweet wipes $14bn off Tesla's value
item.description: The tweet was one of several bizarre postings, including a promise to sell his possessions.

item.title: Boy shot and man injured in east London
item.description: Police found the boy, believed to be 11 years old, and a man injured at a property in Upminster.

item.title: Coronavirus: Parents urged to keep up child vaccinations
item.description: NHS England says all essential vaccinations are still being provided despite the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: National Trust 'faces Â£200m losses this year'
item.description: The conservation charity calls for urgent support for wildlife sectors amid coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: Charlotte takes food to those in need as she turns five
item.description: Four photos taken by the Duchess of Cambridge show the princess helping deliver food in Norfolk.

item.title: The Papers: Charlotte turns five and 'virus class divide'
item.description: New photographs of Princess Charlotte feature on Saturday's front pages to mark her fifth birthday.

item.title: Coronavirus R0: What is the R number and why does it matter?
item.description: Experts keep discussing the value of R, but what is it and why does it matter?

item.title: Coronavirus: 12 hours with paramedics on the Covid front-line
item.description: Tina Brennan is often the first point of contact for patients who are seriously ill with coronavirus.

item.title: Week in pictures: 25 April - 1 May 2020
item.description: A selection of news photographs taken around the world this week.

item.title: Coronavirus: Trump is selling coronavirus coins and other claims fact-checked
item.description: Fact-checking claims about coronavirus coins, a Nobel Prize winner's fake quote and a bot network exposed.

item.title: My Money: 'With love on my side, I can get through today'
item.description: As part of a BBC blog series, Leena Yousefi in Canada talks us through one week during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Times Like These: All-star Foo Fighters cover goes to UK number one
item.description: The lockdown version of Times Like These replaces Colonel Tom Moore at the top of the UK charts.

item.title: Nordic Islands seen in their 'surreal light'
item.description: The breathtaking landscapes of Iceland, Greenland, Norway and the Faroe Islands.

item.title: Double rainbow appears during clap for carers tribute
item.description: As people stepped out to show their thanks for key workers, rainbows appeared in the sky across England.

item.title: Coronavirus: A toast to my cancelled wedding
item.description: Today was going to be my big day until Covid-19 intervened. But that won't stop me delivering my speech.

item.title: Coronavirus: The foster dad home-schooling 10 North Korean boys
item.description: As millions of parents grapple with the challenge of home-schooling, one has a very tough task.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why so many people are dying in Belgium
item.description: Belgium believes its high Covid-19 mortality rate is down to more rigorous counting of cases.

item.title: 'I'm at risk of gambling again in lockdown'
item.description: Gambling companies have halted TV and radio ads during lockdown - but not online ads.

item.title: Coronavirus: Coping with lockdown on poor broadband
item.description: Slow wi-fi under lockdown and how to speed it up.

item.title: Coronavirus: How can I help?
item.description: Giving blood, writing a diary, or reading a story to your friends' children are just some of the options.

item.title: Coronavirus: Three continents, four lives, one day
item.description: The stories of people who died on one day, from an exile who returned home to a disaster survivor.

item.title: Neutral venues needed to finish Premier League season
item.description: Neutral venues will be the only way to complete the 2019-20 season, Premier League clubs are told during a video conference on Friday.

item.title: Anthony Joshua v Tyson Fury talks with interested venues begin
item.description: A historic fight between Anthony Joshua and Tyson Fury moves a step closer as the parties involved begin talks with interested venues.

item.title: Premier League great escapes: Which one did you vote the best?
item.description: Have a look back at who pulled off the Premier League's best survival acts - and find out which one you voted the greatest.

item.title: Three test positive for coronavirus at German club Cologne
item.description: Three people at Cologne test positive for coronavirus, the German club has confirmed, although they say training will "continue as planned".

item.title: F1 to create 'biosphere' environment for teams when racing starts
item.description: Formula 1 plans to create an isolated environment for competitors when it starts racing again in July.

item.title: 'Cricket must wait for safety guarantee before it resumes'
item.description: Cricket cannot resume until coronavirus testing and safety significantly increases, says Lancashire chief executive Daniel Gidney.

item.title: Gossip: Jiminez open to Barca and Real, Bale eyes MLS
item.description: Raul Jimenez open to moves to Barcelona and Real Madrid, Moussa Dembele to Man Utd, Dean Henderson poised for another loan, plus more.

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine: When will we have one?
item.description: We answer some of the big questions about vaccines and how long one for coronavirus could take.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why did the UK need 100,000 tests a day?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should the public wear face masks?
item.description: There is growing discussion about the potential benefits of the general public wearing masks.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why are international comparisons difficult?
item.description: Should you be comparing Covid-19 statistics between countries?

item.title: Coronavirus symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson is among those to be treated in hospital for the symptoms of Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: How long does it take to recover?
item.description: Recovery from Covid-19 can be a lengthy process, depending on how seriously people get the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Everybody should be avoiding non-essential contact, and you should stay at home wherever possible.

item.title: Coronavirus: A visual guide to the economic impact
item.description: Key maps and charts explain how the virus has impacted markets and businesses around the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Coronavirus: The world in lockdown in maps and charts
item.description: With more than a million coronavirus cases confirmed worldwide, an analysis of the world in lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: What do all the terms mean?
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak

item.title: What is the coronavirus?
item.description: Everything you need to know about the coronavirus â explained in just one minute.

item.title: Coronavirus death rate: What are the chances of dying?
item.description: The current best guess of a 1% death rate does not apply to everyone.

item.title: Coronavirus: When will the outbreak end and life get back to normal?
item.description: The huge challenge the world faces to find an exit strategy to end the lockdowns and return to normal.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'How I'm coping with self-isolation'
item.description: With the impact that coronavirus is having on our daily lives, people are finding new ways to fill their free time.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I'm begging you, please be careful'
item.description: A woman being treated for coronavirus has made an appeal for people to stay home.

item.title: Coronavirus update: Why does staying at home help?
item.description: After Boris Johnson brings in new measures, the BBC explains why staying in is a matter of life and death.

item.title: Ultra-Orthodox and trans: 'I prayed to God to make me a girl'
item.description: Growing up as a Hasidic Jew, Abby Stein had no idea trans people existed - she just felt sure she was a girl.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I never thought I'd be so proud to sell bread and butter'
item.description: Laura McLellan felt humbled when she and her team of checkout operators were told they were key workers.

item.title: 'Nobody told us about the coronavirus pandemic'
item.description: Before setting sail around the world, Elena and Ryan told their families not to give them bad news.

item.title: Coronavirus: Protecting the 'one in a million' girl
item.description: Bex Price's family went into isolation early as coronavirus would almost certainly kill her.

item.title: Coronavirus: Making face masks feels 'like the war effort'
item.description: Thousands of people are producing cloth masks, despite UK authorities saying they are unnecessary.

item.title: Coronavirus journey: The 'last cruise ship on Earth' finally comes home
item.description: From political storms to presidential pleas, it has been quite a journey for the MSC Magnifica.

item.title: The tiny premature baby who fought off coronavirus
item.description: Peyton Maguire from Lanarkshire is one of the youngest Covid-19 patients in the UK.

item.title: How Typhoid Mary left a trail of scandal and death
item.description: The chilling story of an Irish immigrant cook who brought typhoid to well-to-do families in New York.

item.title: Coronavirus: Grandmas' top tips to get through lockdown
item.description: We've asked Grannies from around the world for their advice on staying positive.

item.title: A coronavirus survivor's story: 'I touched death'
item.description: Elizabeth says she feels lucky to be alive after falling seriously ill with the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Wacky and wonderful scrubs for NHS workers
item.description: Hundreds of volunteers are making scrubs of all different designs and colours for doctors and nurses.
